title: About
text:

     Github
  

      
Hello, I’m Carter.
I am an MA candidate at the University of Waterloo, where I study in Clara Colombatto’s Vision and Cognition Laboratory.
My research asks: when humans interact with other people, are there low-level cues (e.g., velocity of anothers’ movements) that (1) allow for inferences about others (e.g., others’ intentionality) and (2) influence the cognition of the observing person (e.g., their attention)?
Check out my research >

title: About
text:
I am an MA candidate at the University of Waterloo, where I study in Clara Colombatto’s Vision and Cognition Laboratory.
My research asks: when humans interact with other people, are there low-level cues (e.g., velocity of anothers’ movements) that (1) allow for inferences about others (e.g., others’ intentionality) and (2) influence the cognition of the observing person (e.g., their attention)?
This website includes my research publications, data analysis projects I am proud of, and a blog where I post some scientific and non-scientific writing.
